meanings.definition: A list or record of items.
meanings.sent1: I keep a catalog of my favorite books on my shelf.
meanings.sent2: The library has a catalog of all the available books.
meanings.sent3: My cat knocked over my catalog, and now everything is mixed up!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a catalog of memories, neatly organized and easily accessible.
meanings.sent5: The catalog of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To make a list or record of items.
meanings.sent1: I will catalog all the items in the store for inventory.
meanings.sent2: She likes to catalog her stamp collection meticulously.
meanings.sent3: I cataloged my friend's jokes to use in my stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: His brain seemed to catalog every detail of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The scientist would catalog each new species he discovered.

meanings.definition: A publication containing a list of items for sale.
meanings.sent1: I received a catalog from the furniture store in the mail.
meanings.sent2: The fashion catalog displayed the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: The catalog of toys made me wish I was a kid again.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a catalog of happiness, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The catalog of exotic fruits made my mouth water.
